rooms.name: Footpath on a Hillside
rooms.description: A lightly worn, narrow footpath winds along a grassy verge.  The path skirts a clump of bushes here as it approaches a large open area to the north.  It is impossible to see too far to the north due to a slight ridge in that direction. The hillside slopes downward to the south, and maples and beeches grow in scattered clusters all arond.  The path continues south toward the entrance to a tall tower which looms to the southwest.

rooms.name: Path Beside a Pond
rooms.description: A small-ish pond lies here in a broad meadow in the hills.  This spot is near the southwest corner of the pond, and a path enters from the south, then turns west to skirt the edge of the water.  Cattails grow in thick profusion in the shallow water.

West.description: The path skirts the pond, following it to the west.

rooms.name: Path Beside a Pond
rooms.description: A light footpath skirts a pond here, beside a flower-laden meadow.  The pond is northeast, beyond a wall of tules growing thick at the edge of the water. To the south, the land slopes gently away under a thick covering of tall, smooth-barked bushes.

East.description: The path follows the edge of the pond to the east.

extras.text: These can only be manzanita bushes, with their pale, almost grayish oval leaves and striking reddish bark.  They interlock with one another, their strong branches forming an impenetrable wall to the south.

Tules are rushes, growing in shallow, motionless water, and often to very large sizes.  These are medium-sized specimens.  The sound of buzzing insects can be heard from their sheltering embrace, and small birds flit to and fro above them, hunting.
The pond itself is obscured behind the tules.  It lies to the northeast, and appears to be somewhat long, continuing a ways to the east.
The meadow is covered with bright flowers and tall grasses that wave gently in the mild breeze.

rooms.name: Meadow on a Hillside
rooms.description: A clearing lies here on a gently sloping hillside, filled with wildflowers of every description.  A few trees and tall reddish bushes encircle the meadow to the south and west.  The low buzz of insects drifts along on a warm breeze. A small body of water is just visible some distance to the east.

extras.text: Violet shooting stars grow scattered all around. Beneath them, almost hiding among the taller grasses, small yellow daisies are almost flat against the ground.
The trees are beeches, of medium height, with straight trunks and large round canopies. Their dark green leaves rustle in the wind.

rooms.name: Meadow on a Hillside
rooms.description: A profusion of flowers grows here in the forest's embrace.  Small white blossoms pepper the ground beneath tall, reedy plants that sport odd, scarlet, star-like blooms.  Over to the side in a semi-shaded spot, some milkweed grows and emits a surprisingly pleasant odor.  Trees and undergrowth grow thick to the northwest, but the opening continues south, and east toward a glistening pond.

extras.text: With their shocking yellow centers and streaming crimson petals, these can only be columbines.  They tower over the other denizens of the meadow, preferring shade to direct sunlight.

These tall, grayish, fuzzy plants grow in the shade near some helpful beeches. Their broad leaves show signs of being munched on, perhaps by some tolerant insect who doesn't mind the acrid-tasting sap that oozes from the bites.

rooms.name: Path Beside a Pond
rooms.description: A slight depression, with smaller plants than elsewhere, barely indicates the route of what must have once been a path here.  It runs north-south alongside a medium-sized pond to the east.  Beyond the tules, the water of the pond is still and quiet.  A clearing in the forest lies to the west.

North.description: The path seems to fade to the north, but the trees are thinly scattered, and it would be easy to follow the pond's bank.

South.description: The path runs south alongside the tules.

rooms.name: Beside a Pond
rooms.description: A few beech and oak trees crowd up against a pond here.  The land is mostly level, except for a gentle slope that rises to the north.  Insects sweep back and forth across the surface of the pond, and small, swift birds chase them down with surprising efficiency.

rooms.name: Wood Beside a Pond
rooms.description: Numerous beech trees and a pair of giant oaks are scattered about the hillside.  A small pond, just off to the southeast, lies beside a ridge to the north.  Some odd-looking trees peek over the ridge, but they are too far away to make anything out.  It is possible to follow the ridge east or west, or to make your way along the pond's edge to the south.

rooms.name: Between a Ridge and a Pond
rooms.description: A few willow trees grow on the marshy shore of a pond to the south.  Here, the land is dry, and a steep east-west ridge prevents northward movement. Other than that, the land is level.  Larger deciduous trees grow to the west, and the branches of what appear to be fruit trees peek over the ridge.

extras.text: The ridge is stony, and obscured by grass and a little bit of moss.  As you look closer, however, it becomes apparent that the stones are laid in rows. It appears that this is a retaining wall, although it's in poor repair.

The branches peeking over the ridge are long, spindly, and slightly curved. Looking higher up, you can barely see a small, round, wizened fruit.  It's a sickly shade of orangey-brown, and quite wrinkled.

rooms.name: Between a Ridge and a Pond
rooms.description: A narrow strip of land, squeezed between a ridge to the north and a pond to the south, comes to an end here.  The only exit is west.  The pond is fairly long and continues some distance east and west.  Some sort of graceful, black-barked tree is growing up above the ridge, but other than a few pale lavender flowers, little can be seen.

extras.text: There are some clusters of small, pale, lavender flowers high up on the tree above the ridge.  The tree is fairly large and healthy.  Most of it is not visible from here.
The ridge is steep and stony, and rises up about ten feet.  It blocks the way north.  It's fairly regular and straight for a ridge, and is covered with vegetation.

rooms.name: Hillside Below a Ridge
rooms.description: This is a wooded hillside, with a gentle slope, that lies just south of a steep ridge.  Some steps have been carved into the ridge so that it's possible to climb them from here.  They are partly hidden below a few gorse bushes, and are generally overgrown, but serviceable.  It is also possible to follow the ridge to the east, where the trees thin out.

rooms.name: Mossy Walkway
rooms.description: Here in the middle of the forest is an odd sight: a slate-paved walkway, covered with damp green moss.  It comes from the south, where a set of steps leads down, and curves to the east.  There, what appear to be fruit trees are growing in rows.  The tall dark trees of the forest loom to the north and west. A pond is visible far to the southeast.

rooms.name: Chortling Wood
rooms.description: The forest is dark and damp, with giant oak and beech trees looming over thick underbrush.  The ground is fairly clear here.  Oddly, the usual silence of the woods is broken by an odd chattering or chortling sound.  It seems to be coming from underfoot.

Down.description: The forest litter is a bit lower in a somewhat square-shaped spot. Is there something hidden underneath it?

rooms.name: Silent Wood
rooms.description: This is a small area in an old forest, where large trees tower overhead and thick underbrush impedes movement.  The shade and the moisture in the air conspire to chill the area.  These conditions are favorable to the foxgloves, which dot the area with tall flower stalks.

extras.text: If these are foxgloves, then foxes must have small, simple paws.  At any rate, the blooms resemble tiny caps or hoods, hung from their tips downward at an angle.  They are a light purple or violet in color and are covered with brownish dots.  The leaves of the plant grow mainly in a large flat circle down at the base of the stalk.

rooms.name: Root Cellar
rooms.description: This room is rather dark and cool.  It is small, and the walls and floor are made from bricks which are stained and rotting.  Roots of many sizes have grown through and reach all the way down.  On the north side, a trickle of water flows in.  A shelf of granite juts out from the wall beneath it, forcing it outward, so that it dribbles onto the floor with a constant tinkling sound. Piles of rotten wood lie beneath the other walls, while a tight tunnel leads west.

West.description: Though small, the tunnel looks large enough to be crawled through.

Up.description: A rusted grate covers an opening above a set of handholds in the wall.

rooms.name: A Cozy Orchard
rooms.description: Unpruned fruit trees grow here, where the forest encroaches from the west. The view to the southeast is beautiful.  There, a pond reclines among tules and willows.  The trees to the north and east appear to be cultivated as well, though they are no better cared-for than these.

rooms.name: A Cozy Orchard
rooms.description: Old fruit trees grow all around, except on the west, where the forest is attempting to invade the orchard.  The crumbling remains of a stone wall do little to slow the forest's advance.  Peach pits, fresh and otherwise, are strewn across the ground, a testament to the productivity of these trees. Little fruit remains, however.

rooms.name: A Cozy Orchard
rooms.description: A single peach tree grows here, but it is very old indeed.  Its main trunk is dessicated.  Only a few leaves grow on the single remaining lively branch. The forest, eager to reclaim this land from the interlopers, encroaches from the north and west.  This appears to be the corner of the orchard, and more fruit trees are visible to the south and east.

rooms.name: A Cozy Orchard
rooms.description: Large apple trees grow through an unkempt layer of underbrush.  Their long, untrimmed branches grow in profusion from thick stubs where they were once pruned regularly.  Regular rows of holes dot their trunks, no doubt the work of some sweet-loving animal.  The ground drops off to the south, affording a view of a flowery meadow and a pond.  On the east, a thorny, hedgelike bramble blocks the way.

rooms.name: A Cozy Orchard
rooms.description: This is the middle of a small orchard, and apple trees grow here among copious weeds.  The trees look fairly healthy, in spite of numerous small holes drilled into their bark.  Thorny brambles surround them on the north and east. More fruit trees are visible in every direction, including those portions of the orchard invaded by the brambles.

rooms.name: An Overgrown Orchard
rooms.description: Signs of cultivation are visible here, but the orchard has not been tended in some time.  Round river stones and the crumbling remains of mortar poke out of the grass to the north.  Thorny brambles grow to the southeast, choking trees and blocking movement.  A few large stumps poke out of the weeds here, their fruit-bearing days long past.

rooms.name: Silent Wood
rooms.description: Beeches, oaks, and sturdy underbrush make movement difficult.  The forest is oddly quiet.  The hillside slopes steeply upward to the north and east, but seems altogether level just south of this place.  There is an opening in the undergrowth to the east, and a wide open area to the south.  The undergrowth is passable to the north as the hills slopes downward tward the east.

rooms.name: An Overgrown Orchard
rooms.description: A high stone wall, in poor repair but standing, surrounds this orchard on the north and east.  However, whatever trees were planted have succumbed to time and competition, for little remains but a few rotting stumps.  Nasty brambles and stinging weeds have taken their place.  The orchard extends west and south.

rooms.name: An Overgrown Orchard
rooms.description: A healthy thicket of thornbushes encroaches on the orchard, choking everything in its path.  All movement to the south and west is blocked by it. A tall stone wall lies to the east.  In spite of the bushes, a single slender cherry tree stands tall.  It seems healthy enough, but sadly bears neither blossoms nor fruit.

South.description: Another cherry tree peeks over the brambles to the south.  It appears to be healthy, and a ripe cherry hangs high up in its branches.

rooms.name: Drainpipe
rooms.description: This is a small tunnel reinforced with brick and stone.  Water trickles down the middle, and large black roots break through the walls and ceiling, thirsting for the water.  The water is draining to the west.  From the east, the trickling noise is much louder.

rooms.name: Damp Nest
rooms.description: This is a snug little underground hollow, with stone-lined tunnels on the eastern and western sides.  It's filled with all manner of junk, such as colored stones, scraps of metal, and bone fragments.  Water is trickling in through the eastern tunnel, but drains quickly away through the earth.

rooms.name: Drainpipe
rooms.description: This snug little drain turns a corner here, leading east and south.  The bottom, lined with slate, is as dry as anything else here under several feet of damp earth.  Nevertheless, many woody roots have pushed through the walls and ceiling in search of moisture.  They show signs of being cut or broken, and the tunnel remains passable.

rooms.name: Drainpipe
rooms.description: The drainpipe comes to an end here at a metal grating.  The grating is choked with dirt, rocks, roots, and the like.  Some especially heavy roots have grown through the roof of the drainpipe.  Darkness lies in the many hollows where the earth has fallen from the roots.  The pipe continues to the north. Fresh air is coming in from above.

Up.description: A tunnel rises up among the roots.

rooms.name: A Cozy Orchard
rooms.description: A single, slender cherry tree grows in this tiny clearing.  It is surrounded by a stone wall on the east, a steep drop to the south, and thorny bushes to the north and west.  In spite of these obstacles, the area shows signs of tending.  The tree is pruned and the weeds have been pulled for a few feet in every direction from its trunk.  There is a large hole in the ground next to the tree.

Down.description: The hole leads straight down. The many roots through which it descends may provide handholds.

rooms.name: Silent Wood
rooms.description: An old forest, full of large trees, grows right up to a stone wall that lies to the south.  The wall is old, and in some places cracked, but it remains sturdy.  Ferns grow in the protective shade of the trees, and moss and lichens coat the rounded stones in the wall.

rooms.name: Silent Wood
rooms.description: A deciduous forest of beeches, maples, and oaks crowds up against a tall stone wall.  The wall makes a corner and leads south and west.  A few branches and small stones lie against the wall, but do not block the way entirely. Shelf fungi jut out from the rotting wood and emit a somewhat pleasing musky odor.

extras.text: The fungi are as large as your hand, with bright orange flat tops and spongy yellow bottoms that taper toward the base.  They smell nice.

rooms.name: Silent Wood
rooms.description: A high stone wall stands here, to the west of a cluster of brightly-colored maples.  The brilliant red and yellow leaves drift to the ground slowly.  The leaves collect in a drift against the wall, and get hung up in the twining branches of the bushy undergrowth that makes passage through the forest difficult.

rooms.name: Silent Wood
rooms.description: A forest of oak trees and maples covers the sloping hillside, which rises to the northeast.  A crumbling stone wall lies to the west.  Just visible beyond it are the upper branches of a cherry tree.  A narrow path leads east into the forest.  Acorn cups and decaying leaves collect along the base of the wall, among the fallen river stones used to build it.

extras.text: The cherry tree seems healthy enough, with a profusion of green leaves and no visibly diseased twigs.  However, it is not blooming, nor is it bearing fruit.

rooms.name: Top of a Ridge
rooms.description: This is the top of a moderately high ridge, above a meadow with a pond to the south.  Up here, a deciduous forest grows right up to a crumbling stone wall.  The wall lies to the west, and goes north from the ridge.  It has partly fallen down, and a cherry tree is visible beyond it.

extras.text: The cherry tree on the other side of the wall is slender, and has few branches for its height.  However, it is healthy and has several blooms in addition to a single ripe purple cherry.

rooms.name: Buzzing Wood
rooms.description: The woods seem to be host to a number of buzzing insects, whose constant noises are unmistakable, but difficult to locate.  The forest is, for the most part, impassable.  Somewhat clear spots, which might once have been part of a path, lie to the east and west.

rooms.name: Beside a Pond
rooms.description: Cattails grow on the banks of a pond to the north.  A gently sloping meadow surrounds the water, and is home to a variety of flowers and tall grass.  Just beyond the pond to the north, a raised flat area is covered with trees and ruins of some kind.

extras.text: Very little can be seen from this distance - perhaps the end of a stone wall.

rooms.name: Flowery Meadow
rooms.description: The land rolls gently underfoot, sloping to the north, where a pond nestles among cattails and willows.  Flowers and the occasional small bush dot the landscape.  A small peninsula juts north into the pond, and a large tree seems to be growing on it.

rooms.name: A Small Peninsula
rooms.description: This tiny finger of land juts out into the quiet waters of a hillside pond. Fireflies and midges spiral and swoop out over the water.  In the middle of the peninsula is a large weeping willow whose drooping branches nearly form a curtain.

extras.text: The silent dance of the fireflies can be rather soothing to watch. They seem to blink almost in unison, although there must be thousands! On closer inspection, one of the fireflies doesn't seem to be blinking at all... and it's much brighter than the others.

rooms.name: Mudflat
rooms.description: A trickle of water from the east has transformed this area into a wide expanse of sloppy mud.  It is filled with cattails and long grasses.  Algae lines the western edge of the mud, beyond which is the pond.  A ridge, covered with scrubby bushes and long grass, rises to the north.

rooms.name: Flowery Meadow
rooms.description: Wildflowers of every kind grow all around.  The hillside slopes down both north and south from this spot, toward a little pond to the north, and a deep valley to the south.  There are few trees nearby, but a vast deciduous forest lies to the north.

rooms.name: Flowery Meadow
rooms.description: Lush green grass and clusters of poppies cover the hillside.  The ground is a bit dry here, but the plants show no sign of thinning.  The sounds of larks and blackbirds fill the air, almost drowning out the faint sound of giggling that's drifting in from the east.

rooms.name: Meadow by a Pond
rooms.description: A still, quiet pond lies to the west of this lush meadow.  Willows compete with cattails for space along the pond's bank.  A cluster of white lilies grows a little farther from the water, competing for attention with a tall dogwood tree in full bloom.  The shade under the dogwood is nice and cool.

rooms.name: Buffalo Hollow
rooms.description: This is a buffalo hollow - a small depression filled with flowers, but not with water - so named because of the perception that buffalo used them to hide in.  No buffalo are in evidence, however.  The hollow is not so low that the surrounding land is hidden, and a pond can be seen to the west, while a ridge and a stream are off to the north.

rooms.name: Hillside Meadow
rooms.description: Here on the southern slope of some low hills, a gently sloping meadow lies in quiet repose.  Off to the north, a small waterfall flows down a ridge, and there is a pond to the west.  A tall, thick stand of gorse bushes lies directly to the east.

rooms.name: Meadow by a Stream
rooms.description: Just below a stony ridge to the north, a stream flows by.  The water flows to the west toward a misshapen pond.  All around to the south is a meadow filled with wildflowers.  Beyond the meadow is a forest.

rooms.name: Meadow by a Waterfall
rooms.description: A wide, gently sloping meadow surrounds this spot from the south, ending here at the bottom of a ridge.  A stream of water is falling over the ridge here, into a small pool and out to the west toward a pond.  The sound of rushing water is relaxing.

extras.text: The waterfall is about twelve feet high.  Its water glistens in whatever light is available, be it from the sun, the moon, or only the stars.  Thick mats of moss grow on the stone to either side.

rooms.name: Edge of a Meadow
rooms.description: This is the edge of a meadow in the hills, bounded on the north by a high ridge and on the east by a thicket of thorny bushes.  A bit of mist seems to be floating through the area.  Oddly, it is not coming from the direction of a small waterfall to the west, but from the east.  Also, a path cuts through the bushes leading into the mist.

rooms.name: A Misty Menhir
rooms.description: Several paths converge here upon a small clearing in the middle of a thicket of thorny bushes.  The paths lead north, south, and west.  It is misty here due to a cool breeze that is carrying fog in from the north.  To the east, the bushes give way to a dark oak forest.

rooms.name: Thick Fog
rooms.description: Thick dark fog flows into the area constantly, from an unseen source. Treetops are visible above it, as is a high stone ridge to the north.  It is not immediately obvious which ways are clear to leave, but the trees do seem a bit thinner to the south.

rooms.name: Hillside Path
rooms.description: A winding little path passes between bushes and small trees here on a hillside.  It is little more than a game trail, perhaps used by deer.  There appears to be a clearer area in the northwesterly direction, and more and more trees to the east.  The path can be followed north and east.

East.description: A delicate-looking web stretches between two trees, blocking the path.

rooms.name: Hillside Path
rooms.description: A tiny path winds among tall green bushes and small, hardwood trees.  The hillside slopes downward to the south.  The trees are small here, but a forest looms to the east with mature beeches and oaks.  The path comes to an end here in a tiny little clearing.

rooms.name: Hillside Path
rooms.description: Young trees grow among clusters of bushes on this hillside.  These medium- sized oaks and beeches are much smaller than those in the more mature forest to the east.  The sound of running water is barely audible.  It seems to be coming from a point some distance to the north.  A light trail goes east.

rooms.name: Path in the Woods
rooms.description: A narrow trail runs through the woods going east and west.  This is the edge of a forest, where mighty beeches grow close together and shade the earth below.  It seems to open up a bit to the north.  Leaves, twigs, and other litter covers the ground in a thick mat.

rooms.name: A Drippy Passage
rooms.description: This is a narrow passage carved into dark gray stone.  Water drops from the ceiling and the walls and floor are slick and wet.  Black stains and dark algae streak the walls and make the floor slippery.  A massive stone slab sits at the southern end of the tunnel, which continues north into the darkness.

rooms.name: A Rough Tunnel
rooms.description: This tunnel is low and oval-shaped, and passes through solid rock.  Water trickles down the sides through grayish mats of slime.  Mud, leaves, and other detritus covers the floor.  The tunnel comes from the south and veers upward here.  Wisps of fresh air come down from above occasionally, but there is no steady breeze.

rooms.name: Ridge by a Stream
rooms.description: Mighty oaks grow in a thick forest all around, except to the south.  There, a steep ridge falls fifteen feet down into the fog.  A footpath follows the ridge east past the gnarled roots of weathered trees.  It is also possible to wade in the stream to the west, which is falling over the ridge.  A hole in the earth leads down into darkness.

rooms.name: Above a Waterfall
rooms.description: Water flows between spiky boulders to the north and plunges over a steep ridge to the south.  Giant oak trees grow all around, but down below the ridge is a meadow.  The forest looks mostly impassable, but there is a small clear spot to the east.

South.description: You can walk out over the edge of the waterfall, but be prepared for a sharp drop!

rooms.name: Brisk Waterfall
rooms.description: Water is falling quickly past this point from a stream overhead.  A solid stone wall to the north is streaked and wet.  Below, a pool churns as the waterfall plunges into it.

rooms.name: Ridge by a Forest
rooms.description: The crumbling rocky edge of a ridge runs east-west here.  This is the top, where an old forest of broadleaved trees covers the hillside to the north. There is a steep drop to the south.  A small path leads north into the forest, or west along the top of the ridge.

rooms.name: Dark Forest
rooms.description: Grizzled oaks with huge trunks darken the forest floor with their canopies. Even at noon, this place is shrouded in shadow.  Still, dark-leaved bushes grow all around.  A very narrow path, faint but readable, passes north-south among the bulbous roots of the silent trees.

rooms.name: Dark Forest
rooms.description: Dark forest giants tower overhead.  The understory lies in perpetual shade. A few seedlings struggle hopelessly to break out of their dark prison, among the stolid and thorny bushes.  There is little noise or movement.  A faint path winds among the mighty trunks from north to south.

rooms.name: Dark Forest
rooms.description: This forest, while thick and crowded elsewhere, is amazingly dense here.  A solid wall of impenetrable trunks blocks northward movement, and the faint path from the south makes a sharp turn to the east.  Oddly, the forest's stillness is disturbed by faint noises whose distance is difficult to judge.

North.description: The trees are very regular, almost forming a wall with their trunks. Indeed, they all look pretty much the same.

rooms.name: Dark Forest
rooms.description: Silence reigns in the shady understory of this forest, where mighty oaks and beeches grow.  Slender vines reach for sunlight through bristly, intransigent bushes.  An extremely faint path seems to pass through from west to east.  It shows little sign of use, however.  A low hump of earth sits several yards to the north; it seems oddly out of place.

rooms.name: Dark Forest
rooms.description: The trees seem to close in here, and the faint path from the west shows no signs of continuing.  The forest floor seems a little bit depressed.  A low mound sits incongruously off to the north.

rooms.name: Steep Pit
rooms.description: Crash!  You fell through a screen of twigs, small branches, and leaves into a pit!  Luckily, the bottom is covered with forest litter - a few sharp spikes are visible near the pit's walls, but those in the middle are too deeply buried to harm anyone.  Also, the wall of the pit has crumbled over time, and it should be no trouble to climb back out.

rooms.name: Fairy Ring
rooms.description: A wide clearing nestles here in the heart of the forest.  This is the southern edge, where part of a ring of orange, green, and brown toadstools swings around.  The mouldering trunk of a fallen tree lies directly on the ring to the east.  A few bits of grass attempt to take advantage of the lack of trees, but for the most part, only the fungi rise unmolested through the litter of brown and decaying leaves.

extras.text: The toadstools are growing in a broad ring over a foot wide.  This is only the southern edge; it swings east and west, curving toward the north in each case. The toadstools themselves range from short and squat to tall and fat.  They are somewhat slimy and smell like fungus.

The tree appears to have fallen some time ago.  Even so, the rate of its decay is remarkable: while some dead leaves still cling to a few of the upward-pointing twigs, all of the wood near the ground is crumbling and infested with white filaments.

rooms.name: Dark Forest Path
rooms.description: A light path runs through an old forest, meandering among the trunks of mighty beeches and oaks.  Darkness lies all around, but the path leads to an open area some distance to the north.  The path also leads south through shadows.

North.description: A delicate-looking web stretches between two trees, blocking the path.

rooms.name: Middle of the Fairy Ring
rooms.description: This is the center of a large clearing in the middle of a dark forest.  A ring of large toadstools grows all around.  The ground is clear here, as if it had been raked or tended to on purpose.  However, a few slender bones lie scattered about.  There are too many footsteps to make out any individuals, but a path leads south.

extras.text: A closer inspection reveals that most of them are fairy bones.  The remainder are cruder and more difficult to identify, perhaps belonging to a predatory bird.

rooms.name: Fairy Ring
rooms.description: The western arc of a rather large fairy ring passes through the area, its orange, brown, and green toadstools giving off an aroma of earthy decay.  The mighty oaks of the surrounding forest are well back to the west.  Neither they nor their saplings attempt to impinge upon the circle.

extras.text: The toadstools sport irregular white blotches on their caps, regardless of color.  The orange ones are shaped like a flattened, curving cone, while the brown ones are taller and more cylindrical.  The green ones vary, and are usually covered with bumps and ripples.

rooms.name: Fairy Ring
rooms.description: A large fairy ring of spotted toadstools passes by on the northeast.  It is surrounded by an old oak and beech forest, which keeps a respectful distance. In spite of the lack of trees, little grows here except the fairy ring itself. The forest itself is impassable.

rooms.name: Fairy Ring
rooms.description: A broad ring of earth-colored toadstools occupies a clearing in the forest here.  This is the northern edge, and the hillside's upward slope begins just beyond the nearest trees.  A few straggly plants grow near the tree roots, but there are no flowers.

rooms.name: Fairy Ring
rooms.description: A fairy ring, composed of large, ugly toadstools, spreads out into a clearing to the southeast.  Little grows in the clearing but the odorous fungi that give it its shape.  A few oak and beech leaves from the surrounding forest lie on the ground.

rooms.name: Fairy Ring
rooms.description: This is a large clearing in an old forest, whose stolid trunks form an impenetrable barrier to the northeast.  Within the clearing, a large ring of toadstools encircles a cleared area.  The smell of the toadstools is unavoidable, and while not overpowering, it is somewhat unpleasant.

rooms.name: Crown of the Fallen Giant
rooms.description: A swath of large toadstools, forming a broad ring, is rudely interrupted here by the fallen trunk of a massive oak.  Its roots once gripped the earth off to the south, and it fell in this direction, evidently some time ago.  All of the toadstools growing under it are unbroken, and the tree is in an advanced state of decay.  Indeed, white filaments poke out from its wood everywhere, even where it is only slightly damp.

rooms.name: A Path in the Foothills
rooms.description: A light path rambles up the foothills to the north.  Small sections of the Grey Spray Road are just visible in the distance to the south, down below.  A few lonely oaks grow here and there, while a mature hardwood forest grows farther up the hills.

rooms.name: A Path in the Foothills
rooms.description: The path rises as it goes north, away from the road and into the foothills. A few flowers and bushes grow here and there.  Trees are fairly scarce.  The Grey Spray Road is clearly visible to the south.

rooms.name: Silent Wood
rooms.description: Beeches, oaks, and sturdy underbrush make movement difficult.  The forest is oddly quiet.  The hillside slopes steeply upward to the east and south, and seems to crest to a level area just south up the path through the undergrowth. The undergrowth lessens to the west as the hill steeply descends and the trees seem to be quite different in that direction even to the untrained eye.

rooms.name: Silent Wood
rooms.description: Beeches, oaks, and sturdy underbrush make movement difficult.  The forest is changing as the hill slopes.  The way is very steep but passable as the brush increases to the east climbing the hill.  Mangrove trees seem to be mixing with the oaks and beeches to the south.  It is possible to proceed downslope to the north, or back upslope to the east.

rooms.name: Mangrove Forest
rooms.description: The deciduous trees finally begin to fall away and the ground becomes level here at the beginning of a mangrove forest.  Brackish water appears out of the ground whenever anyone heavy steps on it.  Back to the south, a hill begins to climb out of the mangroves and towards a more deciduous forest.  The mangrove swamp continues to the north.

rooms.name: A Mangrove Swamp
rooms.description: The forest has truly become a swamp here.  Knobby mangrove roots push their way through the brackish water, making passage difficult in any direction.  It seems to be slightly clearer to the north, where the swamp continues, and to the south, where there is a hillside farther off as well as different kinds of trees.  Insect and plant life is abundnt here, and the waters occasionally move with the passage of fishes and, undoubtedly, predators.

rooms.name: A Pocket in the Void
rooms.description: This is a small space in an infinite void.  Nothing much happens here.
